name: Home Assistant Yellow front
description: Top side of Home Assistant Yellow

components.description:
USB boot mode jumper. Allows recovery via USB-C (J3).

Setting this jumper will force the CM4 into USB boot mode. See J3 for more
details.

This jumper allows to force nRPIBOOT to GND.

USB-C functionality selector

Selects the functionality of the USB-C connector. See J3 for more details.

Radio LED (blue)

See [Home Assistant Yellow LEDs](/guides/yellow-leds/) documentation for
detailed description on patterns their meaning.

Status LED (yellow)

See [Home Assistant Yellow LEDs](/guides/yellow-leds/) documentation for
detailed description on patterns their meaning.

Activity LED (green)

See [Home Assistant Yellow LEDs](/guides/yellow-leds/) documentation for
detailed description on patterns their meaning.

Power LED (red)

See [Home Assistant Yellow LEDs](/guides/yellow-leds/) documentation for
detailed description on patterns their meaning.

M.2 B-Key connector.

Note this conector only has power and 1xPCIe Gen 2 connected.

Wipe Button

Allows to wipe all user data from your Home Assistant OS installation.
Press and hold until the yellow LED starts to blink to initiate a user
data wipe.

Hold this button and the power button simultanously to delete all boot
files from the internal eMMC or NVMe. This allows to reinstall HAOS using
the Home Assistant OS Installer for Yellow.

Power Button

When Home Assistant OS is running, press and hold for 5s to power off the
system.

USB-C connector (USB 2.0 device only)

Depending on JP1 configuration this connector allows to:

* UART: Access the serial console via USB to UART connector. See the following guides for how to use the serial console:
  * [Using the serial console for debugging (Windows)](/guides/use-serial-console-windows/)
  * [Using the serial console for debugging (Linux)](/guides/use-serial-console-linux-macos/)
* USB: Access the CM4 as an USB device (e.g. for recovery)
  * [How to re-install the operating system](/guides/reinstall-os/)

[Silicon Labs MGM210P](https://www.silabs.com/wireless/zigbee/efr32mg21-series-2-modules) wireless radio.

Zigbee/Thread capable IEEE 802.15.4 radio connected to the CM4 via UART.

Available on `/dev/ttyAMA1`, typical baud rate is 115200 with hardware
flow control.
